Class Brick

java.lang.Object
  Brick

public class Brick
extends Object

the brick class allows you to create individual brick objects for brickbreaker

Version:
December 18, 2013
Author:
David Lovitz

Constructor Summary
Brick(int x, int y, int w, int h)
          this is the main constructor for the brick class and creates a new and alive brick given an x and a y coordinate
 
Method Summary
 int getHeight()
          the getHeight method allows you to get the bricks height
 int getWidth()
          the getWidth method allows you to get the bricks width
 int getX()
          the getX method allows you to get the x coordinate of the bricks upper left corner
 int getY()
          the getY method allows you to get the y coordinate of the bricks upper left corner
 boolean isAlive()
           
 boolean isInside(int x, int y)
          the isInside method allows you to check to see if a certain (x,y) point is inside the bricks bounds the method returns a boolean true if the coordinates are inside the brick
 void kill()
          the kill method allows you to destroy the brick, it sets the isAlive boolean to false
 void paintComponent(Graphics g)
          the paintComponent method draws the brick
 
Methods inherited from class
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Brick

public Brick(int x,
             int y,
             int w,
             int h)
this is the main constructor for the brick class and creates a new and alive brick given an x and a y coordinate

Parameters:
x - takes the x coordinate for the upper left corner of the brick
y - takes the y coordinate for the upper left corner of the brick
w - takes the width of the brick in number of pixels as an integer
h - takes the height of the brick in number of pixels as an integer
Method Detail

getHeight

public int getHeight()
the getHeight method allows you to get the bricks height

Returns:
brick_height an integer containing the bricks height

getWidth

public int getWidth()
the getWidth method allows you to get the bricks width

Returns:
brick_width an integer containing the bricks width

getX

public int getX()
the getX method allows you to get the x coordinate of the bricks upper left corner

Returns:
brickX returns the x coordinate as an integer

getY

public int getY()
the getY method allows you to get the y coordinate of the bricks upper left corner

Returns:
brickY returns the y coordinate as an integer

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()

isInside

public boolean isInside(int x,
                        int y)
the isInside method allows you to check to see if a certain (x,y) point is inside the bricks bounds the method returns a boolean true if the coordinates are inside the brick

Parameters:
x - takes the x coordinate of the point you wish to check
y - takes the y coordinate of the point you wish to check

kill

public void kill()
the kill method allows you to destroy the brick, it sets the isAlive boolean to false

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(Graphics g)
the paintComponent method draws the brick

Parameters:
g - takes a Graphics object
